info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 8 at 8:59PM CDT until July 9 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Tarrant.
* WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are forecast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Arlington, Haltom City, Hurst, Burleson, Watauga, Benbrook, Saginaw, White Settlement, Crowley, Forest Hill, Azle, Richland Hills, River Oaks, Kennedale, Everman, Sansom Park, Lake Worth, Rendon and Eagle Mountain.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT
